police.methodcalls

Class StreetLevelCrimeMethodCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • police.methodcalls.BaseMethodCall
      • police.methodcalls.StreetLevelCrimeMethodCall
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StreetLevelOutcomesMethodCall

    public class StreetLevelCrimeMethodCall
extends BaseMethodCall
    Represents a call to the Police API which returns a list of crimes within a mile of a given point or within an area specified.

    You cannot specify a point and an area at the same time.

    Author:
    filip
    See Also:
    The Police API documentation of this method

      • addDate

        public StreetLevelCrimeMethodCall addDate(java.util.Date date)
        Only show crimes from the given month
        Parameters:
        date - A month to show crimes from
        Returns:
        this object for further modification

      • addPoint

        public StreetLevelCrimeMethodCall addPoint(double lat,
                                  double lon)
        Specify a point used to look up crimes. The remote method will return crimes that happened within a mile of this location.

        Awesomely, you can just put GPS coords here :)

        Parameters:
        lat - The latitude
        lon - The longitude
        Returns:
        this object for further modification

      • addAreaPolygon

        public StreetLevelCrimeMethodCall addAreaPolygon(double[][] poly)
        Specify an area in which to look for crimes. Area cannot be larger than 20 sq km.
        Parameters:
        poly - An array of GPS coordinate pairs [[lon,lat],...] that describe the polygon. No need to close this poly as the server will just draw a straight line for you from the last point to the first one.
        Returns:
        this object for further modification

      • getStreetLevelCrime

        public java.util.Collection<Crime> getStreetLevelCrime(java.lang.String category)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       APIException
        Call the API and retrieve a Collection of Crimes that was returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a connection could not be created -- see BaseMethodCall.doCall(String, java.util.Map)
        APIException - When the API returned a non-200 code. Typically, there would be too many crimes to return (over 10000), or the request URL exceeds 4094 characters (upstream API supports POST parameters, but the client code does not).
        Parameters:
        category - The category to filter the crimes by, can be obtained via CrimeCategoriesMethodCall.
        Returns:
        A Collection of Crime.
        See Also:
        BaseMethodCall

      • processCrimes

        protected java.util.Collection<Crime> processCrimes(java.lang.String raw_json)
        Processes the response into a collection of Crime objects
        Parameters:
        raw_json - the JSON response
        Returns:
        a collection of crimes

      • getStreetLevelCrime

        public java.util.Collection<Crime> getStreetLevelCrime()
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       APIException
        Get all the crimes for the specified parameters
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a connection could not be created -- see BaseMethodCall.doCall(String, java.util.Map)
        APIException - When the API returned a non-200 code. Typically, there would be too many crimes to return (over 10000), or the request URL exceeds 4094 characters (upstream API supports POST parameters, but the client code does not).
        Returns:
        a collection of crimes
        See Also:
        getStreetLevelCrime(String)
